                            float gridExtents,

        Will draw a grid on the XY plane using the default color
        Parameters:
        gridExtents - How far to make the grid in both directions
        gridSize - How many units each grid will be

        Parameters:

      • drawOrigin

        public static void drawOrigin(PGraphics pg)
        This will draw some lines at the origin. Red for X axis, Green for Y axis, and Blue for Z axis. The longer side indicates the positive direction

        length - The overall length of the line that will represent the point

      • drawSegment

        public static void drawSegment(PGraphics pg,
                               PVector segmentTop,
                               PVector segmentBottom,
                               float extendAmount,
                               boolean drawPoints)
        This will draw a line between two points, and optionally draw the points too
        Parameters:
        segmentTop - The top of the segment
        segmentBottom - The bottom of the segment
        extendAmount - How much, if any, to extend the segment
        drawPoints - Whether or not to draw the points at the end of the segment. Default point size will be the extendAmount / 2 or 5, whichever is bigger

      • drawGradientLine3D

        public static void drawGradientLine3D(PGraphics pg,
                                      PVector start,
                                      PVector end,
                                      int startColor,
                                      int endColor,
                                      int divisions)
        Will draw a gradient line in 3d
        Parameters:
        pg - The PGraphic to draw on
        start - The PVector starting point
        end - The PVector ending point
        startColor - The starting color for the line
        endColor - The ending color for the line
        divisions - How many mini segments to break it up into. Should be 2 or more

      • drawGradientLine2D

        end - The PVector ending point
        startColor - The starting color for the line
        endColor - The ending color for the line
        divisions - How many mini segments to break it up into. Should be 2 or more

                              PVector lower,

        Parameters:
        lower - One of the PVector corner points
        upper - The other PVector corner point

                              PVector lower,

                              boolean fill)
        This will draw a box based on two corner points in space
        Parameters:
        lower - One of the PVector corner points
        upper - The other PVector corner point
        fill - Boolean whether or not to use a fill on the box or just draw the lines

        Will draw a plane as specified without a fill color for the plane
        Parameters:

        planeSize - How big to draw the plane - overall
        outlineColor - The color used to outline the plane

        planeNormal - The PVector of the plane normal
        planeSize - How big to draw the plane - overall
        outlineColor - The color used to outline the plane
        fillColor - The color to fill the plane

        public static PVector rotateXYZ(PVector ptIn,
                                PVector originIn,
                                double rotX,
                                double rotY,
                                double rotZ)
        This will rotate a point around an origin point in the x, y, and z
        Parameters:
        ptIn - The original point
        originIn - The origin point to rotate around
        rotX - How much to rotate around the x axis
        rotY - How much to rotate around the y axis
        rotZ - How much to rotate around the z axis
        Returns:
        The resultant PVector

      • rotate3D

        public static PVector rotate3D(PVector segmentStart,
                               PVector segmentEnd,
                               float angle,
                               PVector ptIn)
        This will rotate a PVector around an axis for a given amount
        Parameters:
        segmentStart - PVector of the start of the segment
        segmentEnd - PVector of the end of the segment
        angle - The angle of rotation from the original point around the segment axis
        ptIn - The original point to be rotated around the axis
        Returns:
        PVector of the resultant rotation

      • findSignedAngle2D

        public static float findSignedAngle2D(PVector a,
                                      PVector b)
        This will find the signed angle between two 2d PVectors
        Parameters:
        a - The first PVector
        b - The second PVector
        Returns:
        the signed angle from the first to the second PVector. Positive = clockwise

      • findNearestLineConnection

        public static ArrayList<PVector> findNearestLineConnection(PVector p1,
                                                           PVector p2,
                                                           PVector p3,
                                                           PVector p4)
        This will find the closest connection between two nonparallel lines
        Parameters:
        p1 - First point of segment 1
        p2 - Second point of segment 1
        p3 - First point of segment 2
        p4 - Second point of segment 2
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of PVectors with the two connection points

      • findPointLineConnection

        public static PVector findPointLineConnection(PVector targetPoint,
                                              PVector p1,
                                              PVector p2)
        This function will find the closest point on a line from a given point. It may not be the most efficient method, but eh..
        Parameters:
        targetPoint - The PVector in question
        p1 - The first PVector point that defines the line
        p2 - The second PVector point that defines the line
        Returns:
        The PVector of the closest point

      • find2DSegmentSegmentIntersection

        public static PVector find2DSegmentSegmentIntersection(PVector pt1,
                                                       PVector pt2,
                                                       PVector pt3,
                                                       PVector pt4)
        Will find the intersection of a segment and segment in 2d space. This will return null if the segments do not intersect.
        Parameters:
        pt1 - First point of the segment
        pt2 - Second point of the segment
        pt3 - First point of the segment
        pt4 - Second point of the segment
        Returns:

      • pointIsOnSegment

        public static boolean pointIsOnSegment(PVector pt1,
                                       PVector pt2,
                                       PVector pt3,
                                       float tolerance)
        This will check whether or not a point is on a segment given a tolerance
        Parameters:
        pt1 - The point in question
        pt2 - The first point of the segment
        pt3 - The second point of the segment
        tolerance - The amount of tolerance allowed.. because the world is not a perfect place
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the segment

      • pointIsOnLine

        public static boolean pointIsOnLine(PVector pt1,
                                    PVector pt2,
                                    PVector pt3,
                                    float tolerance)
        This will check whether or not a point is on a line given a tolerance
        Parameters:
        pt1 - The point in question
        pt2 - The first point of the line
        pt3 - The second point of the line
        tolerance - Given a bit of tolerance if you want
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the line

      • find2DRaySegmentIntersection

        public static PVector find2DRaySegmentIntersection(PVector pt1,
                                                   PVector pt2,
                                                   PVector pt3,
                                                   PVector pt4)
        Will find the intersection of a line and segment in 2d space
        Parameters:
        pt1 - First point of the ray
        pt2 - Second point of the ray
        pt3 - First point of the segment
        pt4 - Second point of the segment
        projectionOk - Whether or not it is ok to project from the line. If not it will return null if the segments do not intersect
        Returns:

      • findPlaneSegmentIntersection

        public static PVector findPlaneSegmentIntersection(PVector pt1,
                                                   PVector pt2,
                                                   PVector planePt,
                                                   PVector norm,
                                                   boolean projectionOk)
        This function will find the point where a segment/line intersects with a plane
        Parameters:
        pt1 - PVector of the first point of the segment
        pt2 - PVector of the second point of the segment
        planePt - PVector point on the plane to be intersected
        norm - PVector defining the normal of the plane
        projectionOk - boolean of whether or not projection of the segment to the plane is ok if they don't intersect, [in other words, treating the segment as an infinite line]
        Returns:
        null if the segment does not intersect the plane and projectionOk passed in as false, otherwise passes back the intersection point

      • findGroupCenter

        public static PVector findGroupCenter(ArrayList<PVector> pointsIn)
        This will find the AVERAGE of all PVectors in a list
        Parameters:
        pointsIn - The ArrayList of PVectors to be averaged
        Returns:
        The PVector average

      • findExtentsCenter

        public static PVector findExtentsCenter(ArrayList<PVector> groupIn)
        This will find the center of the XYZ extents of an ArrayList of PVectors
        Parameters:
        groupIn - The ArrayList of PVector objects
        Returns:
        A PVector in the middle of the XYZ extents

      • findExtents

        public static ArrayList<PVector> findExtents(ArrayList<PVector> groupIn)
        This will find the XYZ extents of an ArrayList of PVectors
        Parameters:
        groupIn - The ArrayList of PVectors
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of PVectors the lowerLeft and upperRight

      • projectPVectorToPlane

        public static PVector projectPVectorToPlane(PVector ptIn,
                                            PVector projectionNormal,
                                            PVector planePt,
                                            PVector planeNormal)
        This will project a PVector onto a plane which is defined by a point and a normal
        Parameters:
        ptIn - The original point
        projectionNormal - The direction which the pt should be projected with
        planePt - A point on the projection plane
        planeNormal - The normal of the projection plane
        Returns:
        Returns the PVector of the projection point

      • projectPVectorToPlane

        public static PVector[] projectPVectorToPlane(PVector[] ptsIn,
                                              PVector projectionNormal,
                                              PVector planePt,
                                              PVector planeNormal)
        This will project a series of points onto a plane
        Parameters:
        ptsIn - The PVector[] of the points to be projected
        projectionNormal - The direction which the pt should be projected with
        planePt - A point on the projection plane
        planeNormal - The normal of the projection plane * @return A PVector[] of the projected points
